intro: Reseda affinis, commonly known as lesser reseda, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and produces small, yellow flowers clustered in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Reseda affinis is often found in grasslands, wastelands, and along roadsides, thriving in disturbed soils.
